item.title: Why the Best Place to Live in the US Will Be the [[Rust Belt]] - YouTube
item.description: Why the Best Place to Live in the US Will Be the [[Rust Belt]] - YouTube Weather is very favorable, lots of fresh water in lake, and built around [[Public Transportation]] Very cold, but infrastructure is well adapted for harsh cold References (References:: Why the best place to live in the US will be the Rust Belt - YouTube)

item.title: Electric Cars Are Not Sustainable and They're Terrible - YouTube
item.description: Electric Cars Are Not Sustainable and They’re Terrible - YouTube Electric Cars are terrible. Gas cars are worse Electric Cars take 3-5 years to pay off with the rare earth minerals inside them (that are excavated with lots of CO2) Car infrastructure requires: ^8e4894 More spacing More pipelines More asphault More everything All to serve less people References (References:: Electric Cars are Not Sustainable and they’re Terrible - YouTube)

item.title: The Case for Carbon Tax
item.description: The Case for Carbon Tax We should try economists’ favorite solution: the carbon tax. Economists overwhelmingly love the carbon tax, calling it “very close to the economic ideal,” because it gives us a desperately-needed incentive to discourage corporations’ wildly unsustainable polluting, while also letting those corporations figure out how to maintain their services most efficiently.
